intro: Cleyera ochnoides, commonly known as the roughleaf cleyera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually rough in texture. It produces small, white flowers followed by small, red berries. Cleyera ochnoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
